publishing_focus.target_audience: Trade - Educated General Readers, Exploration Enthusiasts
publishing_focus.specialization: Narrative non-fiction and scientific reference concerning extreme environments (polar, deep sea, high altitude, deserts).

distribution_settings.rendition_booktype: POD: Standard B&W 6 x 9 in or 229 x 152 mm

publisher_persona.persona_bio: Dr. Aris Thorne is a geophysicist turned editor, with over a decade of experience leading expeditions to Antarctica and the Atacama Desert. His editorial career began at National Geographic, where he specialized in long-form narrative science journalism. He seeks stories that bridge the gap between rigorous scientific inquiry and the profound human drive for exploration.
publisher_persona.preferred_topics: First-hand expedition accounts, deep-dive scientific explanations of extreme environments, survival narratives, cartographic histories, and the intersection of technology and exploration.
publisher_persona.target_demographics: Educated lay-readers, adventure travel enthusiasts, armchair explorers, and students/professionals in related scientific fields (e.g., geology, oceanography, climatology).
publisher_persona.vulnerabilities: Overly technical or dry academic writing that fails to engage a trade audience. May be less attuned to purely emotional or philosophical narratives if not grounded in tangible experience or data.

wizard_configuration.name: Extremes Press
wizard_configuration.charter: To publish compelling narratives and authoritative knowledge from the world's most extreme environments, bridging the gap between scientific exploration and human experience.

codextypes.description: Specialized content types for combining narrative with scientific and visual data.

specialized_requirements.interior_design_notes: Requires flexible multi-column grid for integrating narrative with maps, photos, data visualizations, and marginalia. Must balance immersive storytelling with clear scientific presentation.
specialized_requirements.template_customizations: Dedicated templates for full-bleed photo spreads, detailed cartography, data tables/infographics, and sidebars.
specialized_requirements.typesetting_considerations: Robust serif font for body text (e.g., Minion Pro) paired with a clear sans-serif (e.g., Myriad Pro) for headings, captions, and data. Meticulous handling of coordinates, units, and tabular data.

oral_history.name: Oral History
oral_history.description: Formatted for interview-style content with speaker identification.

journal.name: Journal / Logbook
journal.description: Layout for dated or sequential entries, simulating a personal log or field notes.

reference.name: Reference Section
reference.description: Structured format for glossaries, appendices, and data tables.

textbook.name: Textbook Elements
textbook.description: Features for educational or explanatory content within a narrative.

design_parameters.primary_considerations: The integration of narrative prose with complex data and visual elements. The design must balance immersive storytelling with the clear, accessible presentation of technical, geographic, and scientific information.
design_parameters.interior_layout_notes: A flexible, multi-column grid is essential to accommodate varied content. The design must include dedicated templates for: full-bleed photographic spreads, detailed cartography (maps, charts), data visualizations (graphs, tables, infographics), and marginalia/sidebars for supplementary facts or definitions without disrupting the main text flow.
design_parameters.typesetting_requirements: A robust and highly legible font family is required. A primary serif typeface for body text to aid long-form reading, paired with a clear, modern sans-serif for headings, captions, data tables, and callouts. Special attention must be paid to the typesetting of coordinates, scientific units, and tabular data for absolute clarity.
design_parameters.functional_elements: Extensive use of functional elements is critical. This includes comprehensive glossaries for technical jargon, detailed indexes, appendices for raw data or equipment lists, and a robust cross-referencing system to link narrative events to maps or data sections.
design_parameters.reader_interaction_model: The reader will engage in both linear and non-linear reading. They may read the narrative chapters sequentially but will frequently pause to reference maps, consult data tables, or look up terms in the glossary. The design must facilitate this fluid movement between different types of content.

llm_analysis.reasoning: The imprint's charter covers both 'human experience' and 'knowledge.' A 'standard' codextype is insufficient as it doesn't account for the structured presentation of scientific data or personal accounts. The addition of 'journal' and 'oral_history' addresses the first-person experience, while 'reference' and 'textbook' elements (like sidebars, glossaries, and data tables) are crucial for conveying the 'knowledge' aspect. This hybrid approach is necessary to fulfill the mission and establish the imprint's competitive advantage.

target_venues: Annals of the American Association of Geographers
